info.title: OpenStatus API
info.description:
OpenStatus is a open-source synthetic monitoring tool that allows you to monitor your website and API's uptime, latency, and more. 

 The OpenStatus API allows you to interact with the OpenStatus platform programmatically. 

 To get started you need to create an account on https://www.openstatus.dev/ and create an api token in your settings.

periodicity.description: How often the monitor should run

degradedAfter.description: The time after the monitor is considered degraded in milliseconds

timeout.description: The timeout of the request in milliseconds

retry.description: The number of retries to attempt

code.description: The error code related to the status code.

message.description: A human readable message describing the issue.

docs.description: A link to the documentation for the error.

requestId.description: The request id to be used for debugging and error reporting.

customDomain.description: The custom domain of the page. To be configured within the dashboard.

passwordProtected.description: Make the page password protected. Used with the 'passwordProtected' property.

password.description: Your password to protect the page from the public

showMonitorValues.description: Displays the total and failed request numbers for each monitor

anyOf.description: The monitors of the page as an array of ids. We recommend using the object format to include the order.
The monitor as object allowing to pass id and order

id.description: The id of the status report

title.description: The title of the status report

status.description: The current status of the report

statusReportUpdateIds.description: The ids of the status report updates

monitorIds.description: Ids of the monitors the status report.

pageId.description: The id of the page this status report belongs to

date.description: The date of the update in ISO8601 format

statusReportId.description: The id of the status report

monitorId.description: The id of the monitor associated with the incident

acknowledgedAt.description: The date the incident was acknowledged

acknowledgedBy.description: The user who acknowledged the incident

resolvedAt.description: The date the incident was resolved

resolvedBy.description: The user who resolved the incident

pageId.description: The id of the status page this maintenance belongs to

monitors.description: The monitors that the notification is linked to
The monitors that the notification is linked to

pageId.description: The id of the page to subscribe to

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

401.description: The client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.

402.description: A higher pricing plan is required to access the resource.

403.description: The client does not have the necessary permissions to access the resource.

404.description: The server can't find the requested resource.

409.description: The request could not be completed due to a conflict mainly due to unique constraints.

500.description: The server has encountered a situation it doesn't know how to handle.
